intro: Catoblastus cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas' catoblastus, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive leaf morphology. It typically grows in humid, tropical environments, often in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
